1606099517_1GvDe5pkKGgM4ZXSge4CwhekmWCjp.body:
> [reichama](#comment_44_19M1Unu2z3j9WyiQ1vcgG6yGnPRmTkUkVe): What are good steps to take to prepare oneself?

Do you homework, think, read every opinion (David Icke, Klaus Schwab, etc..) and formulate your own, make a plan and execute it. this is going to impact life as we know it, it won't be quick but gradual. Focus on being healthy, review your diet, do exercise.

Stop gaming, doing porn, watching TV & MSM, crap movies and focus, time is very important, use it properly.
Check your debt make a plan to get rid of it or at least most of it, inflation will make life harder, if you have money saved in the bank, well, it is time to use, as this is an Emergency. Buy some crypto, research first !!

Living in the city in a flat does not looks good for the new scenario, start looking to move to a flatter area not too far and not to close to a city. If you are intrepid enough countryside is the best.

Stock pile some food and water for at least 4 months, SARS-COV-2 will still be used to drive our lives in the process.
Change your car, look for PHEV, at least you will be able to move without petrol.

If you are using mac, sell it now, buy "T Series" Lenovo kinda and install linux, force yourself to learn it. Sell everything you are not using.as well. also luxury stuff and clothes, these may worth cero under hipper-inflation.

Invest in the dentist (and everyone in your family), get reviewed and fixed, I do not recommend being in home arrest with a dental problem, that will kill your brain quickly, pay for it do not use the dental insurance or you will end up worse. This is and investment.

Collect educational material for home schooling, your kids may no be able to go to school or you will have to decide to give them better education instead.

Think "what if" internet is down? no google maps, etc..Switch to Telegram, sounds stupid but having a backup communication with yours and your people network could be helpful if WhatsApp goes down. Also think "what if" no electricity, no water, no gas, yep, it may happen, may be short period week or two, so careful filling your freezer as no light bye-bye food.
 
Make a packing list with the essentials just in case you have one hour to run out, put some IP cameras and home security so you can monitor everything OK to come back.

This is not the apocalypse, they need us, they need our taxes and work, check WEF partners page and see if your job (or your partner) is somehow related to any partner, if not, look to start something on your own and also look to change your job, unfortunately we will need to ensure some income to stay in the grid.

You will end up with ton of stuff, use Calibre, Docfetcher and Recoll to browse your data afterwards.

Lot's of thoughts going on here, from computer software to survival skills in the woods and also China.

I would go back to the focus topic which is, COVID  is the beginning of the Great Reset, and prepare yourself for this change, which BTW is going to happen. Some people and MSM think it will take some time recover to what we were before MAR 2020, forget it, that is an illusion, as Klaus Schwab mention many times in his speeches. 

There is always the question of democracy controlled by the few with rigged elections, political propaganda budgets, controlled MSM, restricted reelection period, impeachment  etc OR less democracy and a quasi totalitarian model, like liders appointed by blood lines, 1984 kind of (https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0087803/), etc. as Noam Chomsky shows in this video , http://127.0.0.1:43110/12MVkvYGcRW6u2NYbpfwVad1oQeyG4s9Er/index.html?view:item+id:15f1_1GvDe5pkKGgM4ZXSge4CwhekmWCjpVsDMA_item_117+type:video

The bottom line is, there will be a moment, possibly short, that you will not be able to have essential services like electricity or food supply, or gas, or water. who knows, but that moment will happen, it will be forced or as a consequence of street fights who knows.

Also once we are reset, there will be new rules, like for example school, travel and work only if you get the shot like Bill wants, among man others.

The point is, you can be in favor or not about this , but you should never say to your children or grand-children (if you have) I didn't know it was coming. So stop porn, stop TV, stop gaming, stop tik-tok and use internet to make you think and question stuff, talk to friends and family about this, debate, respect others opinion even if they do not research.

1606601124_17acbn9sNyYyLJrLfSz3KJxqonKZt.body: Deep Web is not for making money.

> [claude](#comment_48_1MUCEEtbLUYFpc6vqhp4F5u4ia8MJ9RGK1): tell that to the seven gazillion market ads I see every time I try to browse a Tor links list

well , you are not browsing the "dark web", gazillion adds are not .onion adds. You are surfing normal clearnet but hiding your IP through Tor (theoretically as everyone in the darkweb knows Tor is a CIA/NSA honeypot). Therefore, the adds you see are the adds triggered by the IP you are out to the internet. Darkweb sites are .i2p, .onion, zeronet, and freenet sites among others, I do not see money on adds coming from visiting those sites.

> [sturmwaffle](#comment_13_16fvyFvBWz9rDSRtHF54mMqTwVqhUpj5eE): I absolutely agree. A lot of people still believe Tor to be a viable anonymity solution when it is literally sponsored by the federal government of the United States...  [...]

I can not remember very well its name, but I came across a plugin for the browser which browse in the background random pages generating a hell of crap for the guys taping your IP for analysis.
VPNs for sure are shit, all of them, I'm checking Orchid, a kind of VPN based on Crypto so decentralized, may be this is the answer for walking internet without anyone following you.
If you need private communication between two or more parties I recommend to take a look at I2P and Freenet.

> [claude](#comment_49_1MUCEEtbLUYFpc6vqhp4F5u4ia8MJ9RGK1): http://submarhglcl66nz6.onion/http://gdarku42fzpyrfra.onion/gdark/search.phphttp://3bbaaaccczcbdddz.onion/http://visitorfi5kl7q7i.onion/search/http://xmh57jrknzkhv6y3ls3ubitzfqnkrwxhopf5aygthi7d6rplyvk3noyd.onion/cgi-bin/omega/omega [...]

when you use internet from your computer IP the web page you are visiting tracks the IP of the visitor, this is required because it has to replay to that IP the requests. inside the Tor network, your computer encrypts and encapsulates the request in an envelope which is sent to the first Tor router, this router does the same with the envelope, only the last router (gateway) to the web page you are requesting opens the envelope and sends it to the web page, the web will track and respond to this tor gateway IP which will encapsulate and encrypt inside a new envelope sending the response back in the same way router to router till the last router which will open the envelope and sends it to your computer browser. Cutting short, the IP you are showing to the web page is the last tor router IP. However, end router can see total or partially you request/response therefore not too much privacy if someone (NSA/CIA??) control the routers.
